result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry D Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraudulent Writings/By Corp. Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.39(1).
  • Fraudulent Writings/By Corp. Officer, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.39(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $528 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
DA has 10 days to prepare/submit order. Crt to hold for 10 days for objection.

Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  DNA on file. Any other conditions DOC, Probation/Parole Department may impose.

supervisions.notes:
IMPOSED & STAYED. With Huber. Concur to ct 1.
Concurrent with: ct 1

miscConds.notes: $528 to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.

supervisions.notes: Each ct concur & concur to 16CM62. W/H adjudication on cts 1 & 2. If the def completes all of the conditions of probation timely and there are no crimes rising to probable cause, then after the 2 yrs on probation, the State would not object to a motion to dismiss the 2 ct. This also presumes that the def will not pursue expungement for the misdemeanors.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full-time employment/education or combination of or be seeking same, and treatment.
Not handle any money or financial documents belonging to any other individual or business.  Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Summit Credit Union and BMO Harris Bank.

File tax returns each year with a copy to agent and any refunds to restitution.  Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.
$200 DNA surcharge remitted. $253  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.

timeConds.notes: With huber. Credit does NOT apply. If late to report, work release revoked.

miscConds.notes: $243  to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.
All other conditions are the same as count 10 (except jail time).
